entry.title: Host Your Website for Chinese Market
entry.content:
This article is how to build a website for Chinese market series 2. I focus on the server service this time. There will be more articles in the future.

We mentioned how to build a website for Chinese market in the previous article. We will emphasize the cloud service provider on this article.

entry.title: We Always Need Tools for Work
entry.content:
I have changed tools we used since I co-founded this company. It takes time to find the right tool to fit our workflow and culture. Also, there is always switch cost to make the team switch. I wish we can find one tool to serve all the purposes and to use it forever. But, the truth is that it is impossible in the internet industry. I mentioned 5 tools we currently use on the dminorstudio blog. I hope we don’t need to change any of them for a while.

As a Drupal-based web development agency and a remote team, we can not work without online tools. We found it is impossible to use only one tool to serve all purposes. So, We need to integrate several tools into our workflow. Each tool has its own purpose.

entry.title: Be a Remote Worker
entry.content:
Working remotely is the trend in the world. I can expect there will be more remote workers in the next few years, especially in internet-related industries. Remote working is also a skill which I keep learning and improving. I summarize my learning on dminorstudio blog.

Being a remote worker for more than two years, I have learned few things to make it work. If you can find out what your best way to work remotely is. Working remotely will be more productive than working in the office when it comes to creative work.

entry.title: Terminal and Command Line
entry.content:
I am no programmer, but I like to use terminal and command line on my Mac. Command line is very powerful and fast. When I install Shell script, I always forget the path. Write it down here to remind myself:

/usr/local/bin

entry.title: Building a Website in China Is Different
entry.content:
I published this article at my dminorstudio website. This article summarized our learning from our client projects. China has a very dynamic internet market. The regulations change all the time. I plan to keep it updated in the future.

The China internet market is different from the rest of the world. When most of internet world uses Google, YouTube, and Twitter, the Chinese internet world has its own rules. Due to internet censorship, most mainstream web services might not work in China. When our non-Chinese clients want to build up a website in China, the first thing we will do is to switch their mindset from mainstream world to the unique Chinese world.

entry.title: Start to Blog Again
entry.content:
I haven’t blogged more than 1 year. I have written down blog ideas in my GTD software, but never really develop them to be articles.

I will start from small and post my random thoughts first. If I never start, things won’t get going.

entry.title: Turn Off Facebook Game Notification
entry.content: After moving from China to US, I can access Facebook without any firewall. One thing bothering me is I always receive game invitation from my friends. The problem is I never play any games on Facebook. Finally, I find a way to turn off the notification. Here is the link.

entry.title: Everyone Has a Plan
entry.content:
“Everyone has a plan, until he gets punched in the mouth” -Mike Tyson

When I saw this quote first time, I could not agree more. After several yeas, it is truth to me. Even so, we still need to have a plan. But how to adjust and execute your plan when you get bunched is the wisdom we need to develop.

entry.title: Octopress Syntax Highlighting
entry.content:
I just found Octopress can support highlighting syntax according to your programming language. It is easy to do it. You just need to add language 1 after backtick.

The source

The result

There is more info on Octopress documentation.

  1. http://pygments.org/docs/lexers↩

entry.title: Octopress Publisher
entry.content:
I need to deal with Drupal and WordPress during my daily work. When it comes to my personal blog, I want something lightweight, simple, and straightforward. After trying different blog platform, I decided to stay with Octopress.

While using Octopress several times, I realized I always had to fire up terminal and type the certain commands, e,g rake deploy and rake generate. Thus, I started to think how I could automate this receptive work. I tried several solutions, e.g keyboard mastero macro and BBEdit applescript. Finally, I found the simplest workflow for myself, Alred and Octopress publisher workflow.

It is easier to generate and publish post to Octopress through Octoppress publisher. All I need to do is type keyword blog and blog generate in my Alfred. It is done.

When I installed Octopress publisher in the beginning. The function of blog generate didn’t work. I looked into the script and added one line script. It works as I wish now.

Original script

Modified script

entry.title: Be Like a Duck
entry.content: “Be like a duck. Calm on the surface, but always paddling like the dickens underneath.” - Michael Cain

entry.title: Custom Key Bindings in MailMate
entry.content:
I have been using MailMate frequently. Personally, I would think it is a very geeky and one of the best wmail softwares in Mac. One of the strengths is, compared to other email clients, it is highly configurable. I have added one keybord binding to MailMate. The below is how I i did it:

  1. Create a folder in ~/Library/Application Support/MailMate/Resources/KeyBindings/
  2. Create a file called Special.plist
  3. Type file name Special in Custom Key Binding in Preferences.
  4. Put your keyboard binding in Special.plist. The below is my binding:

In my case, I use g+u to navigate to Uread folder. To make it work, you need to find mailbox UIUD. You can find it in ~/Library/Application Support/MailMate/Mailboxes.plist.

That is how I did it. I feel like MailMate is like Vim in email client softwares.

entry.title: Fix RedCloth Error
entry.content: When installing Octopress in my new Macbook Pro, I encountered an error from installing RedCloth. I just tried different ways from Google search. This blog article finally helped me solve this problem.

entry.title: Could Not Start Spork Server for RSpec
entry.content: Try to install Spork and Guard in order to run Rspec more efficiently. After installing both of them, I typed Guard. Then, the message Could not start Spork server for RSpec came out in terminal. In the end, I found out that when I shut down my VPN, the server started successfully. I guess it took too long to run the code with VPN.

entry.title: Using Pinboard in Command Line
entry.content:
I have been using Pinboard for a while. It is a very powerful bookmarking service with minimum interface. Now I can use CLI with pinboard. All I have to do is to install a gem and put a api token.

Install

gem install pinboard-cli

Place API

place it in ~/.pinboard-token

entry.title: How to Install Wget in Mac OS
entry.content:
Wget is a very powerful CLI tool. However, Mac doesn’t have it by default. There are several ways to install. The easiest way is to use homebrew to install. Of course, homebrew has to be installed beforehand. All you need to do is type one command line:

$ brew install wget
